intro: Volvulus spithamaeus, commonly known as the spiral liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its small, leafy structure is adapted for survival in humid conditions. Volvulus spithamaeus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
